skill.name: tests-maintenance
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim test suite quality. Reviews disabled tests, ensures Neovim annotations are documented, and improves test readability. Use for periodic test maintenance.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim test suite quality. Reviews disabled tests, ensures Neovim annotations are documen...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: The skill is instructional text only and does not execute code or access systems. No suspicious behavior or hidden directives were found.

content.value_statement: Test suites drift and lose clarity over time. This skill guides focused checks to restore quality and documentation.
actual_capabilities: Identify disabled tests and suggest re-enable checks
Flag low quality test text for replacement
Provide commands to run targeted tests
limitations: Does not fix production code bugs
Focuses on a small subset per run

use_cases.title: Audit disabled tests
use_cases.description: Review disabled tests and decide which can be re-enabled with clear documentation.

use_cases.title: Improve test clarity
use_cases.description: Replace meaningless strings with realistic content and improve test naming.

use_cases.title: Document Neovim gaps
use_cases.description: Validate @TestWithoutNeovim reasons and add missing descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Quick scan
prompt_templates.scenario: First pass on a test area
prompt_templates.prompt: Review a small set of IdeaVim tests for disabled cases and missing Neovim exclusion descriptions. Report findings only.

prompt_templates.title: Disabled test check
prompt_templates.prompt: Find @Disabled tests in src/test and suggest which could be re-enabled, with notes on documentation quality.

prompt_templates.title: Neovim annotation audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit @TestWithoutNeovim annotations and list entries missing a clear description or reason.

prompt_templates.title: Deep quality pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Select one test file and suggest specific edits to improve content readability and annotation documentation.

output_examples.input: Audit one test file for disabled tests and Neovim exclusions.
output: Found 2 disabled tests without clear reasons
Suggest re-enabling one test after running it
Replace placeholder text in two assertions

best_practices: Review a small test subset per run
Add clear reasons to exclusion annotations
Use realistic test content and names
anti_patterns: Editing production code to fix failing tests

faq.question: Is this compatible with IdeaVim Kotlin tests?
faq.answer: Yes, it targets the IdeaVim test structure and Kotlin annotations.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only provides guidance and does not execute or change code.

faq.question: Does it integrate with Gradle workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, it references standard Gradle test commands.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only contains instructional text.

faq.question: What if a disabled test still fails?
faq.answer: Keep it disabled and document the reason clearly.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: It focuses on test maintenance and annotation quality, not general code style.
